titles.title: Professional Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1995
To provide that professional baseball teams and leagues composed of such teams shall be subject to the antitrust laws.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Professional Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1995 - Amends the Clayton Act to make the antitrust laws applicable to the business of organized professional baseball, except as provided in the Sports Broadcasting Act of 1961.
